publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3167 John Scott: Prestwick Airport’s 70th Anniversary—That the Parliament notes that 2005 marks the 70th anniversary of the establishment of Prestwick Airport by the Scottish aviation pioneers David McIntyre and the Duke of Hamilton; recognises that throughout its history the airport has played a leading role in civil and military aviation and in the Scottish aircraft manufacturing industry, and notes the vital role that Prestwick Airport currently plays in the Ayrshire economy, both as a thriving passenger and freight airport and as a base for engineering industries. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton R*
S2M-3167 Prestwick Airport’s 70th Anniversary (lodged on 17 August 2005) John Swinburne*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Christine Grahame*
